page.title: 02The River Hamble (cont)
page.content:
was launhed at Hamble in 1756. In 1885 Charles Hoare founded the nautical training school known as T.S.Mercury. There he trained boys for the Royal and Merchant navies. After his death in 1908 the famous scholar and sportsman C.B Fry took over and for 42 years continued training.Unfortunately the T.S. Mercury had to close in 1968 due to financial difficulties.However the closing of T.S. Mercury did not mean the loss of Hambles maritime reputation and is still developing throughout the 20th century as a leading leisure area & one of the countries largest yachting centres.
Today the River Hamble hosts thousands of private yachts, 3 mariners, 3 yacht clubs & 2 sailing clubs, a sailing school, many yacht agencies, boatbuild
